newsitem.title: USA: Kohl's Sept same store sales up 8.4 pct.
newsitem.headline: Kohl's Sept same store sales up 8.4 pct.

text.p: Kohl's Corp said Thursday its same store sales for the five weeks ended October 5, 1996 rose 8.4 percent over the comparable period last year.
Same store sales results exclude a discontinued electronics business.
Total sales for the five weeks were up 20.5 percent over the five week period ended September 30, 1995, the retailer said in a statement.

For the 35 weeks ended October 5, 1996, total sales were up 25.9 percent over the 35 weeks ended September 30, 1995. On a comparable store basis, excluding the discontinued electronics business, sales increased 10.5 percent.

Due to a shift in the fiscal accounting calendar, the fiscal month ending dates are one week later this year than a year ago. On a calendar basis, matching the periods ended October 5, 1996 with the periods ended October 7, 1995, total sales increased 21.3 percent for the month and 24.1 percent year-to-date. Comparable store sales on this basis increased 9.8 percent for the month and 9.2 percent year-to-date.
Kohl's said it opened seven new stores in September and plans to open five additional stores in October.
The company currently operates 145 stores, up from 121 stores at the same time last year. By year-end, Kohl's will operate 150 stores.
